container-title: One is H.C. Ørsted (1777–1851), whose discovery of electromagnetism in 1820 was perceived as an almost mystical insight into the hidden forces governing the world. Ørsted was a towering figure in the intellectual life of Golden Age Copenhagen, advancing physics and chemistry, poetry, and a philosophy influenced by Kant and J.G. Fichte. See Hans Christian Ørsted and the Romantic Legacy in Science
